item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, January 28, 2025 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. We're bringing Pebble back (1455 points | 362 comments)
2. Machine Learning in Production (CMU Course) (115 points | 12 comments)
3. Why OpenAI's $157B valuation misreads AI's future (Oct 2024) (29 points | 3 comments)
4. Google open-sources the Pebble OS (847 points | 128 comments)
5. The Taylorator – All Your Frequencies Are Belong to Us (247 points | 77 comments)
6. How we scaled Slack to support 1000s of developers (61 points | 17 comments)
7. The Alpha Myth: How captive wolves led us astray (175 points | 147 comments)
8. Using AI for Coding: My Journey with Cline and LLMs (114 points | 44 comments)
9. Go 1.24's go tool is one of the best additions to the ecosystem in years (155 points | 64 comments)
10. The Vikings also used crampons to avoid slipping on ice (12 points | 4 comments)

12. Complexity physics finds crucial tipping points in chess games (25 points | 6 comments)
13. Dragonsweeper — A minesweeper game that requires observation (61 points | 32 comments)
14. The ocean teems with networks of interconnected bacteria (96 points | 17 comments)
15. My failed attempt to shrink all NPM packages by 5% (303 points | 197 comments)

21. Bilinear down/upsampling, aligning pixel grids, and that infamous GPU half pixel (2021) (107 points | 14 comments)
22. Turning the Database Inside-Out (5 points | 2 comments)
23. A Faster Quantum Fourier Transform (61 points | 4 comments)

25. Operation Leg – a pilot unlike any other (2020) (163 points | 71 comments)
26. The Curious Case of Quentell (70 points | 5 comments)
27. I trusted an LLM, now I'm on day 4 of an afternoon project (189 points | 144 comments)
28. Mineral Oil Cooled PC (2014) (56 points | 49 comments)
29. SiFive's P550 Microarchitecture (143 points | 52 comments)
30. Peanut Butter Day: Going Nuts over NIST's Standard Reference Peanut Butter (2016) (97 points | 56 comments)
